11.7.20  12:56 pm   How to get over a writer's block that's been going on for about 4 years?

      this may not be the answer you're expecting, but .......... write something

11.7.20  12:26 pm   is the bad thing in your song the bad foot tap?

      no, the song was completed before the video was made. but, that is a good example of a bad thing, to start the video off on the right (wrong) foot

11.7.20  12:23 pm   im teaching my nephews piano and i wanted to get your thoughts and ideas on how im approaching it. for the younger ones i am first making sure they know where do is. then the rest of the white notes. teaching them how to sing a major scale. then i invite them to make a song up by plaiyng with the black keys, so they can have pentatonic fun. For the older one, he came to class knowing jingle bells. he likes learning songs. i am thinking of teaching him some chords to play along with jingle bells. but i also am teaching him a bit about the circle of fifths, how it relates to sharps and flats in different keys, and then showing him how jingle bells can be played starting in any note. I am very slowly trying to teach them how to read notes off a pentagram but I feel like that can dampen the excitement for the instrument if it becoems too "academized". I took a look at a teaching book and it doesnt look too fun tbh. maybe the best time to teach them to r ead musi c is when they want to learn a specific song? I can notate it for them and have them read off it? They range ages 4 to 10 probably. Some are more motivated than others but i feel they can all get excited about different aspects of piano/music/learning

      it sounds like you are doing great. maybe you could also do some purely rhythmic exercises. rhythms might be a nice starting place for reading also

11.7.20  12:18 pm   Do you think that gorillas should start a war with monkies?

      no

11.7.20  9:43 am   Album you've listened to recently /recommend? 

      any time i've ever tried to listen to an album, it ruins all the songs. but when i listen to the songs individually, for some reason every song is good. so in conclusion i recommend every song

     more than 1

      more than 1. meaning is so contagious, it's almost impossible for there to be only 1

11.6.20  11:52 pm   how many people would have to be playing instruments and/or singing simultaneously to completely replicate one of your (recorded) songs live

      for an exact replication, just use a recording. but that's not my idea of a good live show. i personally would prefer a band size somewhere between 3 to 14 people

11.6.20  11:29 pm   So is it ok to think you are making music because I'm a musician also?

      it's ok to think that no matter what, but it also happens to be true

11.6.20  10:34 pm   how to get through depression?

      this is not my area of expertise, so forgive me if i am outright wrong about this, but i recommend motion and movement

11.6.20  10:22 pm   who decided that diminished chords were a good idea?

      it must have been songwriters. but i should mention that they usually don't work outside of the song. i'm getting a subtle feeling that you may have somehow been exposed to this outside of songs, which would explain why it might not seem to be working, which i could imagine would cause you to ask this

11.6.20  6:56 pm   how does one get into content creation?

      you could start by having a discussion of what you think is content. i should clarify, this won't really have very much impact on whether or not you make content, but the discussion might determine whether or not you are aware of it
